intro: Daucus nudicaulis, commonly known as the slender parsley. It is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white flowers. Native to North America, it thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant has a taproot system and produces seeds in small, dry fruits. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the carrot family.
